The manual needs to be available in forms other than HTML. Postscript or PDF 
springs to mind since the formats are open, portable and multi-platform. I 
wanted to read the ant documentation on the train. I can't. Pity.
creator: apm35@student.open.ac.uk

text:
We welcome your offer to rewrite the manual in docbook format :)

Actually there is an automated way to generate the core docs in XML using
xdoclet
(http://nagoya.apache.org/gump/javadoc/ant/proposal/xdocs/build/docs/manual/) ;
if you wanted to provide the work to go to PDF from that somehow, we would be
equally grateful.

If it is just a printed quick reference to the tasks, grab appendix E of Java
Dev w/ Ant from your Ant distro or http://manning.com/antbook.
creator: stevel@apache.org
josh.watson@sysmech.co.uk
text:
How is your user manual developed in ant? Is the HTML generated somehow, or is
it hand-written? The link in your old comment doesn't work either :(

I really hate reading DOCs in HTML, especially ones without an index.

If you do generate the docs, I am willing to help find a way to make it into
PDFs and maybe investigate other helpful tools, like index generation scripts.

If your docs are handwritten, I'd be glad to reformat them using a format that
can be used to generate HTML and PDFs. I can't think of one off hand, but I'm
sure one exists.

I'm working on a docbook format version of the manual for the sole purpose of
generating a PDF version.  I didn't see this bug rep and opened a new one.
#33800.  I've uploaded the current PDF to that bug rep.

Kev
